results.title: Now or never
results.creator_credit: Linda Harrar, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
The concluding episode of this series focuses on individuals and organisations who are fighting for the survival of the planet. It emphasises that whilst international treaties and organisations play a major role, individuals can also make a significant difference. The need for cooperation between all nations, rich and poor, has never been more urgent as “we need to make peace with each other in order to make peace with nature”. Narrated by Karina Kelly. A teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Now it can be told
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Royal Air Force. Film Production Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of the training of special agents in Britain and their subsequent work with the French resistance movement. Sabotage culminated on D Day in insurrections by thousands of armed patriots who helped to paralyse the enemy’s communications and hastened its defeat.

results.title: Now is the time to put on your glasses
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: The right eye print of a 3-D films commissioned by the British Film Institute for the Festival of Britain. Photographed paper cutouts and images drawn directly on film stock were given single-frame animation. Stereoscopy was achieved by photographing and drawing two visuals (one for the left eye, one for the right eye) with controlled displacement of the elements in relationship to each other. The hand-drawn sound was also composed and recorded on two separate bands for stereoscopic playing. (Award: Toronto.)

results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart

results.title: Now I am an Australian
results.brief_description:
An migrated with her family to Australia and settled in Richmond. She is actively involved in the Vietnamese community and works toward keeping Vietnamese culture and traditions alive.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Now generation
results.creator_credit: Austral Pacific Productions, National Bank of Australia, Andrew J. Helgeson and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: To be involved with banking is to be involved with people. This is the underlying message on modern career opportunities in one of Australia’s major trading banks. All levels of staff activities are shown in metropolitan, rural and overseas branches. A useful career guide for school leavers.

results.title: Now flow the rivers westward
results.creator_credit: Snowy Mountains Authority and H Malcolm
results.brief_description: The development of the Snowy Mountains Scheme, through the eyes of an English air pilot who comes to work there. Sketches the history of the Scheme, and describes in more detail the building of the Tumut Pond Dam, and the vast underground T1 power station. Shows the variety of activities within the Scheme and several shots of the country from the air.

results.title: Now 7 Years Later
results.brief_description: NOW7 YEARS LATER is a video and sculptural installation, and was first staged at the Fremantle Arts Centre as a commission in response to the 50th anniversary of the City of Fremantle’s collection of art.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.title: Now 'airport'
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of Kennedy Airport which is a hub of perpetual motion and a gateway to America. Every day and night jet planes from all over the world land and depart from this busy international airport - here on film is captured its color, movement and noise.
results.description: An impressionistic study of Kennedy Airport which is a hub of perpetual motion and a gateway to America. Every day and night jet planes from all over the world land and depart from this busy international airport - here on film is captured its color, movement and noise.

results.title: Novo
results.brief_description: After a catastrophic accident, a cloned boy aboard a spaceship finds himself lost in an unknown yet familiar place. He must come to terms with the change of lifestyle and adapt to it. Along the journey he meets some new friends and helps them as best he can.
